column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,17,caa8924710b8202b514da6db241b55135e034369d1bc53d774e1f1bac8c3264e,"The following applies: F_DEST_ADD = Module start address/8.

If you are operating the F signal module in safety mode, this is where you set the F monitoring time for safety-related communication between the F CPU and F signal module (PROFIsafe monitoring time).
You can find information on setting the PROFIsafe monitoring time in the ""Monitoring and system reaction times (Page 137)"" section.
# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

To enable the PCS 7 driver blocks to report interrupts, the diagnostic interrupt for the F signal module must always be activated in safety mode. Various error events, which the fail-safe signal module can define using its diagnostics function, trigger a diagnostics interrupt. ",What is the formula to calculate F_DEST_ADD in the context of the F signal module?,F_DEST_ADD is calculated as the module start address divided by 8.,"To find F_DEST_ADD, divide the module's start address by 8.",The calculation for F_DEST_ADD involves taking the module start address and dividing it by 8.,Module start address/8 equals F_DEST_ADD.,F_DEST_ADD = Module start address divided by 8.

",What is the purpose of setting the F monitoring time when operating the F signal module in safety mode?,"The F monitoring time is set for safety-related communication between the F CPU and F signal module, known as the PROFIsafe monitoring time.",It ensures safe communication between the F CPU and F signal module by defining the PROFIsafe monitoring time.,Setting the F monitoring time is crucial for maintaining safety in communication between the F CPU and F signal module under safety mode.,"To safeguard communication in safety mode, the F monitoring time (PROFIsafe monitoring time) between the F CPU and F signal module is set.",The F monitoring time establishes the PROFIsafe monitoring time necessary for secure communication between the F CPU and F signal module in safety mode.

",Where can information on setting the PROFIsafe monitoring time be found in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,Information on setting the PROFIsafe monitoring time is located in the 'Monitoring and system reaction times (Page 137)' section.,The 'Monitoring and system reaction times (Page 137)' section of the compendium provides details on setting the PROFIsafe monitoring time.,Look for the 'Monitoring and system reaction times' section on page 137 for PROFIsafe monitoring time settings.,"Page 137, under 'Monitoring and system reaction times', contains the necessary information for setting the PROFIsafe monitoring time.","The compendium directs users to page 137, 'Monitoring and system reaction times', for PROFIsafe monitoring time configuration."

",What is the default monitoring time (ms) set for the F-signal modules as per the module parameters?,The default monitoring time is set to 2500 ms.,2500 milliseconds is the predefined monitoring time for F-signal modules.,"As per the module parameters, the monitoring time is 2500 ms.",F-signal modules have a monitoring time default of 2500 ms.,The monitoring time parameter for F-signal modules is established at 2500 ms by default.

To enable the PCS 7 driver blocks to report interrupts, the diagnostic interrupt for the F signal module must always be activated in safety mode. Various error events, which the fail-safe signal module can define using its diagnostics function, trigger a diagnostics interrupt. ",Why must the diagnostic interrupt for the F signal module always be activated in safety mode?,"Activating the diagnostic interrupt allows PCS 7 driver blocks to report interrupts, triggered by various error events defined by the module's diagnostics function.","It enables the reporting of interrupts by PCS 7 driver blocks, necessary for identifying error events through the module's diagnostics.","For PCS 7 driver blocks to effectively report interrupts in response to diagnostics-defined error events, the diagnostic interrupt must be activated.",Activation ensures that diagnostics interrupts can be reported by PCS 7 driver blocks when error events occur.,The diagnostic interrupt's activation is essential for the PCS 7 driver blocks to communicate interrupts caused by diagnostics-identified errors.

",What is the behavior of the F-signal module after channel faults according to the module parameters?,"After channel faults, the module is set to 'Passivate the channel'.",The module's response to channel faults is to passivate the affected channel.,'Passivate the channel' is the specified behavior following channel faults.,"In the event of channel faults, the module parameters dictate passivation of the channel.","Channel faults trigger the module to passivate the channel, as outlined in the parameters."
